divs: Sighting DetailsSunday, March 16 at 5:15 to 5:22 p.m. Saratoga, California. I was looking at the moon in the daylight and noticed a very small object passing infront of it. The object had to be at the outer boundries of our atmosphere, a grain of sand held at arms length could have blocked out the object. The object was an orange-red color, going south very slowly compared to a satellite. I checked out Heavens Above to see if anything was passing in that location at that time and there wasn't anything.
Summary: An orange object passed infront of the moon and continued south.
trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Saratoga
There was one other sighting in Saratoga on or around March 16th 2008
